shared_text:
Care1st Avondale Resource Center
August 25 at 9:01 PM ·

The locations on this map represent free public WiFi hotspots at public libraries, schools, businesses, and other sites. Some sites may offer indoor public access during business hours, others provide access in the parking lot only. Everyone using the sites – outside or inside – is encouraged to practice social distancing precautions, including staying in your vehicle or at least six feet from other users and wearing a mask if necessary. www.connect-arizona.com

shared_text:
Moya Elementary
August 12 at 3:00 PM ·

Our social worker, Ms. Pla, has provided a family guide for Second Step social/emotional online lessons. 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦Second Step is a curriculum she uses to help students understand their feelings and learn how to solve problems. By following this guide below, you will be able to gain access to free online material. If you have any questions, please contact Ms. Pla or call our front office.

Nuestra trabajadora social, la Sra. Pla, ha proporcionado una guía familiar para las lecciones sociales y emocionales en línea de Second Step (Segundo Paso). 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Second Step es un plan de estudios que ella utiliza para ayudar a los estudiantes a comprender sus sentimientos y aprender a resolver problemas. Si sigue esta guía a continuación, podrá obtener acceso a material en línea gratuito. Si tiene alguna pregunta, comuníquese con la Sra. Pla o llame a nuestra oficina.

Isaac School District No. 5 #isaacschools #MoyaElementary #families #students #SecondStep #free #online #lessons

Social Worker / Second Step

Social Worker / Second Step

See more at
isaacschools.org

text:
Moya Elementary
August 4 at 2:40 PM ·

Just a friendly reminder, students need to be logged into their Google Classroom by 8:25 am. All classes begin at 8:30 am. If you need help logging on, please reach out to us.

Solo un recordatorio, los estudiantes deben iniciar sesión en su Google Classroom antes de las 8:25 am. Todas las clases comienzan a las 8:30 am. Si necesita ayuda para iniciar sesión, comuníquese con nosotros.

Regreso a clases Isaac School District No. 5
*Servicio de internet gratis para las familias registradas en el distrito
*Cada estudiante tendrá una tableta o lop top para sus clases
*Entrenamiento para padres sobre internet para apoyar a sus hijos en sus clases
*Maestros desde Oaxaca México para educar a los estudiantes en dos idiomas y sobre todo culturalmente
Regístrese hoy! (602)455-6700 o por internet

post_text:
Hello, teachers, parents, and community!

The Isaac School District team is constantly considering how to maintain a healthy and safe working environment for our students, staff, and teachers. Please view this brief video about the equipment we use to disinfect and sanitize our classrooms, schools, restrooms, cafeterias, and other district facilities. The equipment and its contents meet, if not exceed, CDC guidelines.

Our equipment and disinfectant products are the same ones used by hospitals and government agencies with high pedestrian traffic, such as airports and federal buildings.

We wish you health and safety.

#IsaacSchools #Safeclassrooms

¡Gracias por su tiempo!

shared_text:
Salud Pública del Condado de Maricopa
July 7 at 12:14 AM ·

Recuerde que es un requisito usar una #Mascarilla dentro del condado Maricopa. Aquí detalles de qué consiste ⬇️ y quiénes están exentos.

👉 Niños mayores de 6 años deben usar una mascarilla en sitios públicos donde el distanciamiento social no es posible

👉 Adultos con niños de 2 a 5 años deben hacer un esfuerzo razonable para que los menores usen la mascarilla en sitios públicos cerrados

👉 Todos los que viajan y operan el transporte público deben usar mascarilla

👉 Personal que trabaja en espacios públicos (restaurantes, tiendas, etc.) deben usar mascarilla

Manténgase #Listo, #Preparado, y #Enmascarado 😷

Para lo último de fuentes oficiales en español en nuestra comunidad visítenos 👇

📌Maricopa.gov/COVID19es

#EviteElContagio
#StopTheSpread
#MaskUpAZ
#UseCubrebocas
#EnmascaradoDelDesierto

Heart of Isaac Community Center
July 8 at 3:52 AM ·

My Book
Children and parents will be able to write their own book, Draw their own pictures and be creative. Writing stories allows children to find a voice to express thoughts, feelings and experiences.

As a safety precaution, we will now be setting up appointments to pick-up our weekly activity. Call us at 602-442-0583.

Child does not have to be present to receive a kit, please wear a mask.
----
My Libro
Niños y padres podrán escribir su propio libro, dibujar y ser creativos. Escribir historias permite a los niños encontrar una voz para expresar pensamientos, sentimientos, miedos y experiencias.

Como precaución de seguridad, ahora estableceremos citas para recoger nuestra actividad semanal. Llámenos al 602-442-0583.

El niño no tiene que estar presente para recibir su kit, por favor use una máscara.

post_text:
¡Hola padres y comunidad!

Nos alegra informarles que con una asociación aún más fuerte con el Censo 2020 # 2020Census, ahora usted puede hablar-llamar a la oficina del Distrito Escolar Isaac al 602-455-6700 nos proporcionarnos su número de teléfono, y luego un representante del Censo 2020 se comunicará con usted para ayudarlo a para responder al Censo.

Como recordatorio, su información es estrictamente confidencial y está protegida por ley.

Su respuesta al Censo es muy importante. Haga valer sus derechos cívicos. Responder al Censo ayuda a nuestra comunidad a obtener fondos necesarios. Los datos del censo guían cómo miles de millones en recursos federales se distribuyen a estados y comunidades como la nuestra cada año.

Estén saludables y fuertes.

Gracias,
# 2020Census #MakeIsaacCount

post_text:
Hello, parents and community!

We are happy to inform you that in a stronger partnership with the #2020Census, you can now call the Isaac School District Office at 602-455-6700 to provide us with your phone number, and then a 2020 Census representative will contact you to assist you to respond to the Census.

As a reminder, your information is strictly confidential and protected by law.

Your response matters. Responding to the Census helps our community to get its fair share of funding. Census data guides how billions in federal funding are distributed to states and communities like ours each year.

Stay healthy and strong.

Thanks,
#2020Census #MakeIsaacCount

post_text:
Today we celebrate Juneteenth, the oldest nationally celebrated commemoration of the end of slavery in the United States. Although slavery may have ended there is no doubt that inequitable opportunities and racism continues today.

The Isaac School District honors the importance of Juneteenth and recommits itself as an educational organization; to fight for equality, equity, justice and fairness for all.

#Isaacschools #Juneteenth #education #community #families #equality #equity #justice

We are with you!

Ellos(as) quieren continuar y van a seguir haciendo aportes muy importantes a nuestro país.

post_text:
"The Isaac School District stands with our Black communities against racism, discrimination and violence. As a learning community that strives to ensure equity for all, we must fight against actions of injustice that occur in society. I ask that each of us examine, confront and eliminate our own biases so that each of us can do our part to ensure social justice within our community and in society as a whole."
-Dr. Mario Ventura, ISD Superintendent

#IsaacSchools

Thank you!

Mientras trabajamos juntos hacia un plan para reabrir las escuelas en agosto, estamos pidiendo su opinión. No olvide tomar esta breve encuesta disponible en inglés y español para hacernos saber qué modelo de aprendizaje preferiría para sus hijos.

¡Gracias!

post_text:
¡Hola, padres y comunidad!

Queremos presentarle este video en el idioma indígena Mam invitando a responder al 2020Census – Censo 2020.

El idioma Mam se habla en Guatemala, Chiapas en el sur México, y también como reflejo de la riqueza cultural del Distrito Escolar Isaac es hablado por nuestros padres y estudiantes.

El video tiene subtítulos en español y se dará cuenta que el idioma Mam se apoya del español palabras y expresiones.

Respondiendo al Censo es una forma en que usted, todos los miembros de su familia, y personas que residen en su hogar, digan ¡nosotros contamos y valemos!

Esperamos que estén sanos y seguros.

Gracias al Pastor Antonio Velásquez y su esposa Margarita por su apoyo para la producción de este video invitando a participar en el Censo 2020.

#2020Census #ShapeYourFuture #IsaacSchools #OrganizacionMayaChapin
Gracias

¡Hola, padres y comunidad de Isaac!

En medio de los tiempos difíciles que vive nuestra nación, hoy más que nunca es importante que usted y su familia se hagan contar y contesten el Censo 2020.

Responder al Censo ayuda a nuestra comunidad a obtener la cantidad justa de fondos que merece. Los datos del Censo que están basados principalmente en sus respuestas, y guían como miles de millones de dólares de fondos federales son distribuidos a los estados, y comunidades cada año.

Respondiendo al Censo es una forma en que usted, todos los miembros de su familia, y personas que residen en su hogar, digan ¡nosotros contamos y valemos!

Esperamos que estén sanos y seguros.

Gracias al Pastor Antonio Velásquez por su apoyo para la producción de este y otros videos invitando a participar en el Censo 2020.

Gracias
#2020Census #ShapeYourFuture #IsaacSchools #OrganizacionMayaChapin

post_text:
Hola padres y comunidad!

Hagamos que el Distrito Escolar Isaac cuente para el Censo 2020.

En caso de que aún no haya respondido, hágalo. Hay tres formas sencillas de responder: (1) en línea, (2) por teléfono o (3) completar el formulario del Censo 2020 y enviarlo por correo directamente.

Responder al Censo 2020 ayuda a nuestra comunidad a recibir parte justa de fondos federales que merece. Las respuestas del censo tienen un impacto directo en programas importantes en el Distrito que incluyen: el Programa Después de la Escuela, el Programa de Asistencia Nutricional Suplementaria (SNAP), Medicaid, Programa de Comida Escolar - Desayunos y Almuerzos Escolares, Parques Comunitarios e Instalaciones Recreativas.

Su respuesta al Censo 2020 es muy importante.

Gracias
#ShapeYourFuture # 2020Census #IsaacSchools

post_text:
Hello, parents and community!

Let’s make Isaac School District counts for the 2020 Census.

Just in case you have not responded yet, please do so. There are three easy ways you can respond: (1) online, (2) by phone, or (3) complete the 2020 Census form and mail it directly.

Responding to the 2020 Census helps our community receive a fair share in federal funding. Census responses have a direct impact on important programs including the After School Program, the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), Medicaid, School Meal Program, and Community Parks and Recreational Facilities.

Your response to the 2020 Census matters.

Thanks
#ShapeYourFuture #2020Census #IsaacSchools

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added 51 new photos.
May 22 at 12:34 AM ·

Hello, parents and community!

As the yellow jackets leave their nest in nature, today at Morris K. Udall Middle School (MKU) our very own yellow jacket Eighth Grade scholars were promoted to high school freshmen!

Please enjoy some photos of this cheerful event.

Today’s mobile promotion was bittersweet as we celebrated their accomplishment of finishing Middle School and starting a new chapter in their educational experience.

From the safety of their beautifully decorated cars, parents, and scholars participated in this exciting event where enthusiastic teachers greeted their students and they showed their love and respect for their teachers.

Congratulations scholars, we are very proud of you!

We can’t wait to see the many accomplishments you will achieve in high school and beyond.

Thank you, teachers, for your hard work, and thank you, parents, for being our partners in your students’ educational journey.

#IsaacSchools #MKUproud

Benefits of Matching Games for young children: improve concentration,
train visual memory,
increase short term memory,
increase attention to detail,
improve the ability to find similarities and differences in objects,
help to classify objects that are grouped by similar traits, and
improve vocabulary.

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added 48 new photos — with Pueblo Del Sol Middle School.
May 20 at 11:48 PM ·

Hello Parents and Community!

Recently, we showcased pictures of our kindergarten scholars in a parade celebrating their promotion to first grade! Now, we would like to highlight our promoting eighth graders! Pueblo del Sol School hosted a mobile Eighth Grade promotion ceremony Wednesday morning.

From the safety of their cars, Pueblo del Sol scholars and their parents participated in an exciting curbside eighth grade promotion where enthusiastic teachers greeted their former students, who are now high school freshmen! All scholars showed their love and respect for their teachers.

Congratulations scholars! Thank you for allowing the Isaac School District to be part of your educational journey! We can’t wait to see the many accomplishments you are going to achieve in high school and beyond.

Thank you teachers for your hard work, and thank you parents for being our partners in your students’ educational journey.

#IsaacSchools #PuebloProud

Isaac School District No. 5 added 21 new photos.
May 15 at 10:27 PM ·

Hello, parents and community!

We would like to share a couple of photos of today’s mobile kindergarten promotion at Pueblo del Sol School.

From the safety of their cars, parents and scholars participated in a curbside promotion, where enthusiastic teachers greeted their now former students, who showed their love and respect for their teachers.

Congratulations scholars, we look forward to seeing you in First Grade and being part of your educational journey!

post_text:
¡Hola padres y comunidad!

Nos gustaría compartir este video en español sobre la importancia de responder al Censo 2020.

Su respuesta al Censo es muy importante. Responder al Censo ayuda a nuestra comunidad a obtener una parte justa de fondos. Los datos del Censo guían cómo se distribuyen miles de millones de dólares en fondos federales a estados y comunidades, como la nuestra, cada año.

El #Censo ayuda a que su futuro y el de nuestra comunidad de Isaac sean brillantes #ShapeYourFuture. Diga: yo, mi familia y/o personas que viven en su hogar “contamos” y responda al Censo 2020.

Queremos agradecer a Lisa García por ayudar en la elaboración de este video.

#IsaacSchools #2020Census

post_text:
Hello, parents and community!

We would like to share this video from State Representative Raquel Teran inviting members of the Isaac community to respond to the 2020 Census.

Just in case you have not responded yet, please do so. There are three easy ways you can respond: (1) complete the 2020 Census form and mail it, (2) by phone, or (3) online.

Responding to the 2020 Census helps our community receive a fair share in federal funding. Census responses have a direct impact on important social programs including the After School Program, the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, Medicaid, School Meal Program, and Community Parks and Recreational Facilities.

Please make sure every member at your home is counted and respond to the 2020 Census and in the case you have already responded, thank you!.

Also, you can exercise your civic duties and make sure your neighbor, friend, or a family member has responded as well.

Special thanks to Representative Teran for taking the time in helping with the production of this message.

Thanks

#ShapeYourFuture #2020Census #IsaacSchool

#IsaacSchools #GirlsOnTheRun #5K #Virtual5K #virtual #run #running
shared_text:
P T Coe Elementary School added 8 new photos to the album: Girls on the Run 2020 - Lets Go Virtual!
April 27 at 11:41 PM ·

Yesterday was supposed to be the Girls on the Run 5K at Wesley Bolin Plaza, but the event was canceled. In its place Girls on the Run International held a virtual 5K this weekend. In support of the 3rd, 4th, and 5th grade Girls on the Run team at PT Coe, Mrs. Stallworth, the 2 coaches (me and Nora Mazur, a volunteer coach and volunteer para at Butler), Ms. Appleby, Mrs. Lowey, and Mrs. Egwu all ran and/or walked the virtual 5K this weekend. We want the girls to know we are thinking about them and miss them.

post_text:
These are pictures of our superheroes at Isaac School District #5!
A superhero doesn't need a cape--ours wear masks, gloves, aprons, and hairnets.

Special thanks to our cafeteria staff, warehouse guys, bus drivers, and assistants for all of their help preparing and delivering meals to our students and the Isaac community!
This group has shown their dedication and compassion each and every day during our daily grab-n-go meal service.
Words can not express my gratitude for this GREAT group of co-workers!

-Debbie Gasiorek, SNS
Nutrition Service Director

post_text:
¡Hola, padres y comunidad!

Nos gustaría compartir este breve video del Senador estatal Tony Navarrete invitando a miembros de la comunidad Isaac a responder al Censo 2020 #2020Census.

En caso de que no haya respondido, por favor, hágalo. Hay tres formas sencillas de responder: (1) complete el formulario del Censo 2020 y envíelo por correo directamente, (2) por teléfono o (3) en línea por Internet.

Responder al Censo 2020 ayuda a nuestra comunidad a recibir su parte justa de los fondos federales. Las respuestas del Censo tienen un impacto directo en programas importantes, incluidos el Programa Después de la Escuela, el Programa de Asistencia Nutricional Suplementaria, Medicaid, el Programa de Comidas Escolares y los Parques Comunitarios e Instalaciones Recreativas.

Un agradecimiento especial al Senador Navarrete por tomarse el tiempo para ayudar con la producción de este video.

Gracias :-)

#ShapeYourFuture # 2020Census #IsaacSchools

post_text:
Thank you to all of our students for continuing to learn and keeping up the great work during times like these 😊

Students from Morris K. Udall Escuela De Bellas Artes created art by recycling materials

#education #dedication #leadership #teachers #art #students #recycle #schoolclosure
shared_text:
Morris K. Udall Escuela De Bellas Artes
April 24 at 7:02 PM ·

Students from MKU in Ms. Tracey Owens's class were learning how to write an explanatory essay by using the topic of how recycled materials can be turned into art.

Since then she has received pictures of many art projects created by her students using recycled materials from their homes created during the school closure.

Thank you, scholars, for keeping up the great work!

#education #dedication #leadership #teachers #art #students #recycle #schoolclosure

April 24 at 7:02 PM ·

Students from MKU in Ms. Tracey Owens's class were learning how to write an explanatory essay by using the topic of how recycled materials can be turned into art.

Since then she has received pictures of many art projects created by her students using recycled materials from their homes created during the school closure.

Thank you, scholars, for keeping up the great work!

post_text:
Hello, parents and community!

We would like to share this brief video of State Senator Tony Navarrete inviting members of the Isaac community to respond to the 2020 Census.

Just in case you have not responded yet, please do so. There are three easy ways you can respond, by mail back the 2020 Census form, by phone, or online.

Responding to the 2020 Census helps our community to get a fair share in federal funding. Census responses have a direct impact on areas such as: After School Program, the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, Medicaid, School Meal Program, Community Parks, and Recreational Facilities.

Special thanks to Senator Navarrete for taking the time in helping with the production of this message.



Thanks J

#ShapeYourFuture #2020Census #IsaacSchools

post_text:
It takes #teamwork! Thank you to everyone who makes it possible for our students and community!

#IsaacSchools #students #foodservices #education #carrots
shared_text:
Sun Produce Co-op is celebrating success.
April 23 at 7:05 PM ·

The great rainbow carrot adventure is getting closer to the plates and homes of children and families served by 5 metro area school districts! Where there is a will there is a way - even with school meals being served Summer Food Service Program-style these days, the coordinators at the Arizona Farm to School Network found a way to ensure that the carrots grown by Agritopia Farm, Blue Sky Organic Farms, Maya's Farm and Phoenix Pinnacle Farms will nourish and be enjoyed by 25,000 people starting next week! Wouldn't be happening by the way without the knife skills of some amazing chefs from the Blue Watermelon Project, the Mollen Foundation and Ashley Schimke! Hashtag It Takes Teamwork to get it done. With lots of gratitude everyone! Tempe Elementary School District, Osborn School District, Cartwright School District #83, Phoenix Elementary School District #1, Isaac School District No. 5

"Si usted o un miembro de su familia residen en el área metropolitana de Phoenix, tenemos buenas noticias para usted: ¡All in Education organizará su conversación comunitariia en el área de Phoenix mañana y jueves! Organizarán el seminario web de mañana en inglés y el seminario web del jueves en español .

Su objetivo es tratar de conocer a las familias donde están y comprender los problemas específicos que necesitan abordar ... "Puede confirmar su asistencia aquí: https://allinforeducationaz.com/

Their goal is to try to meet families where they are and get an understanding of specific issues they need addressed..." You can RSVP here: https://allinforeducationaz.com/

Isaac School District No. 5 added 3 new photos.
April 21 at 5:11 PM ·

Hola Padres y Comunidad de Isaac,

En conjunto con el Censo 2020 #2020Census queremos recordarle sobre la importancia de responder al Censo.

Sus respuestas ayudan a informar como miles de millones de dólares en fondos federales son distribuidos a estados y comunidades cada año en la próxima década.

La información que usted provee al Censo es estrictamente confidencial y por ley no se comparte con ninguna otra agencia o departamento de gobierno.

Gracias :-)

#AmericaCounts #ShapeYourFuture #IsaacSchools

post_text:
Mrs. Lewis from Moya Elementary reads Pig The Pug

#IsaacSchools #reading #students #teachers #PigThePug #books #stories
shared_text:
Moya Elementary
April 14 at 5:00 PM ·

Hi everyone!
Are you ready for another story today? Mrs. Lewis will read a story called Pig The Pug. This story is about a dog named Pig who does not like to share his toys. It is super important for us to learn how to share with one another. Sharing teaches us how to be fair to each other by taking turns and compromising/agreeing on something. It is an imporant life skill that will help us with things we do everyday.

¡Hola a todos!
¿Estás listo para otra historia hoy? La Sra. Lewis leerá una historia llamada Pig The Pug. Esta historia es sobre un perro llamado Pig al que no le gusta compartir sus juguetes. Es muy importante para nosotros aprender a compartir entre nosotros. Compartir nos enseña a ser justos con los otros, turnándonos y poniéndonos de acuerdo. Es una habilidad vital importante que nos ayudará con las cosas que hacemos todos los días.

Isaac School District No. 5 #isaacschools #children #students #teachers #education #community #sharingiscaring #reading #readaloud #books

Isaac School District No. 5 added 4 new photos — with 2020census.
April 8 at 9:12 PM ·

Responding to the 2020 Census is a way to participate in the democracy of our great nation and say “I count!”

Your response to the 2020 Census matters, because it can decide the allocation of federal funding for Schools, Health clinics, Fire departments, Roads and Highways.

The Census can shape the future and our community. Please go to www.2020Census.gov to complete your form online.

#ShapeYourFuture

Responder al Censo 2020 es una forma de participar en la democracia de nuestra gran nación y decir “¡Yo Cuento!”.

Su respuesta al Censo 2020 es importante, ya que puede decidir la asignación de fondos federales para Escuelas, Centros Médicos, Departamentos de Bomberos, Carreteras y Autopistas.

El Censo puede dar forma al futuro y a nuestra comunidad. Visite www.2020Census.gov para completar su formulario en línea, hable al 844-468-2020, o envíe su formulario-planilla por correo.
#ShapeYourFuture

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added 29 new photos.
April 3 at 7:10 PM ·

Hello, parents and community!

Please join us in thanking and acknowledging Isaac School District (ISD) Cafeteria and Support Service Staff, who are working tirelessly to pack and deliver breakfast and lunch to our scholars and community.

From Monday to Friday, these amazing ISD staff members are providing at the schools and delivering at designated bus stops breakfast and lunch to our scholars. Not only they are providing school meals; they are giving smiles.

Their strong community support and presence show that Isaac School District cares about our scholars, especially in these challenging times.

The Cafeteria and Support Service staff's dedication and commitment for the wellbeing of our scholars and community is admirable and embodies the ISD values we instill in our community.

Kudos to the Cafeteria and Support Service staff. We are very proud of you! Thank you!

Please check www.isaacschools.org/updates to get information on where the designated bus stops are located.

#IsaacSchools #education

shared_text:
AZGOVERNOR.GOV
Governor Ducey, Superintendent Hoffman Announce Extension Of School Closures Through End Of School Year
text:
AZGOVERNOR.GOV
Governor Ducey, Superintendent Hoffman Announce Extension Of School Closures Through End Of School Year

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added a new photo.
March 30 at 4:36 PM ·

Dear Isaac Community,

Today, Governor Doug Ducey & State Superintendent of Public Instruction Kathy Hoffman announced the extension of school closures in Arizona through the end of the school year.

We will continue to provide meals to our families Monday - Friday from 11:30 am - 1:00 pm at both our school sites and bus stops.

Study packets are available at school sites and resources for learning at home are also accessible online at isaacschools.org/learn. We are also working on a plan to distribute chromebooks and iPads to our students to use at home.

Please continue to visit Isaacschools.org/updates for the latest information during the school closure.

Study packets are available at school sites and resources for learning at home are also accessible online at isaacschools.org/learn. We are also working on a plan to distribute chromebooks and iPads to our students to use at home.

Please continue to visit Isaacschools.org/updates for the latest information during the school closure.

Also, you can access plenty of online resources at www.isaacschools.org/learn

post_text:
The Isaac School District will continue providing breakfast and lunch following the current schedule for all children 18 years old and under. Please visit www.isaacschools.org/updates to find the bus stop closest to you!

You may also visit any one of our schools Monday- Friday 8-9 am for breakfast and 11:30 am - 1:00 pm for lunch
____________________________________

El Distrito Escolar Isaac continuará proporcionando desayuno y almuerzo siguiendo el horario actual para todos los niños menores de 18 años. ¡Visite www.isaacschools.org/updates para encontrar la parada de autobús más cercana a usted!

También puede visitar cualquiera de nuestras escuelas de lunes a viernes de 8 a 9 a.m. para el desayuno y de 11:30 a.m. a 1:00 p.m. para el almuerzo

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added a new photo.
March 20 at 11:44 PM ·

Dear Isaac Community,

Today, Governor Doug Ducey & Superintendent Kathy Hoffman jointly announced the extension of school closures. As such all Isaac schools will remain closed through April 10, 2020.

Please continue to visit Isaacschools.org/updates for the latest information.

Below is the link where you can read the announcement made by Governor Ducey and Superintendent Hoffman.
_________________________________________________
Estimada Comunidad de Isaac,

Hoy, el Gobernador de Arizona, Doug Ducey, y la Superintendenta de Educación del Estado, Kathy Hoffman, juntos anunciaron la extensión del cierre de las escuelas. Por lo tanto, todas las escuelas del Distrito Isaac van a permanecer cerradas hasta el 10 de Abril de 2020.

Por favor continue visitando Isaacschools.org/updates para obtener la información más actualizada.

A continuación está el enlace para leer el anuncio del Gobernador Ducey y la Superintendenta de Educación Publica, Hoffman.

https://azgovernor.gov/governor/news/2020/03/governor-ducey-superintendent-hoffman-announce-two-week-extension-school

post_text:
Congratulations to Sabrina Castillo Medina, a 6th grade student from Morris K. Udall, for winning the "2020 I Can Do It Award" through the Arizona Council for Exceptional Children (AzCEC). The "I Can Do It" award was presented to Sabrina on February 28, 2020 at the AZCEC/CASE Annual State Conference. She was nominated by her teacher, Ms. Ann Norman, in recognition of her academic excellence. We are so proud of Sabrina and look forward to her continued educational success and bright future!

#Isaacschools #school #teachers #community #family #kids #education #isaacfamily #prideofisaac #leadership #icandoitaward

post_text:
The Isaac Elementary School District No. 5 is pleased to announce the intent to submit the competitive grant application for the Nita M. Lowey 21 st Century Community Learning Center (21 st CCLC) after-school program, to the Arizona Department of Education.

The 21 st CCLC grant will offer free afterschool enrichment activities, academic support and homework assistance to support and enhance student’s achievement and personal growth.
text:
The Isaac Elementary School District No. 5 is pleased to announce the intent to submit the competitive grant application for the Nita M. Lowey 21 st Century Community Learning Center (21 st CCLC) after-school program, to the Arizona Department of Education.

The 21 st CCLC grant will offer free afterschool enrichment activities, academic support and homework assistance to support and enhance student’s achievement and personal growth.

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added 13 new photos — with Ron Hoon Fox 10.
March 5 at 11:45 PM ·

Hello, parents and community!

Joseph Zito Elementary continues to celebrate Read Across America by, of course reading a lot, and fostering in our scholars the love for reading.

And this time Ms. Neave and Ms. Bazan 3rd graders scholars had the great experience of a visit of Ron Hoon, the Arizona morning anchor for Fox 10 Phoenix.

Mr. Hoon has been coming to read to Zito Elementary scholars for over 20 years. In fact, he has read to parents of our current scholars when they were in Ms. Neave’s class and now he is reading to their children.

Thank you very much Mr. Hoon for your commitment and dedication to Zito scholars.

Parents and community, please remember to read, read, and read every day.

Thanks
#readacrossamerica #isaacschools

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added 11 new photos — with U.S. Census Bureau.
March 4 at 10:24 PM ·

Hello, parents and community!

We would like to share a couple of photos of the student assembly event “Everyone Counts 2020 Census ” that took place today in Pueblo del Sol Elementary School’s Gym.

Our sensational scholars have been learning about the Census, why it is important to be counted, and our excellent teachers have been adding Census related topics to their daily instruction.

Remember Isaac Community it is very important that everybody is counted for the 2020 Census .

Thanks

@icount2020official @azcensus202
#2020census

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added 18 new photos — with Javier Soto TV.
March 4 at 12:07 AM ·

Hello, parents and community!

We are excited share photos of a distinguished visitor we had at Joseph Zito Elementary today.
For his fourth consecutive year, Mr. Javier Soto, Good Morning Arizona show anchor of Channel 3 and 5, took time out of his busy schedule and came to Joseph Zito Elementary to read to Ms. Neave's 3rd grade scholars.
Also, Ms. Madrid’s 3rd grade had the opportunity to participate in this enriching activity.
Scholars had a very good time and asked questions to Mr. Soto about his work and experiences on TV.
Thank you, for your time and dedication Mr. Soto!
Parents and community, please celebrate this week and every day by reading with your children.

#readacrossamerica #isaacschools

post_text:
The CDC’s comments have generated a lot of concern regarding COVID-19. It is important to note that according to the Maricopa County Department of Health Services there is still a very low health risk to the general public in Arizona.

We are in communication with and receiving guidance from the Maricopa Department of Public Health around this potential issue.

Communications regarding COVID-19 prevention can be found on the Isaac website at www.isaacschools.org

For the most current and accurate information visit: www.maricopa.gov/coronavirus

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added 19 new photos.
February 21 at 8:20 PM ·

Hello, parents and community!

We would like to share a couple of photos of the Instructional Half-Day Training that occurred yesterday, Thursday, February 21, at several Isaac District schools.

Teachers from all grade levels and content areas met with specialists and academic coaches from the ISD Teaching and Learning Department to receive specialized training in Teaching Reading Effectively (Year 1 and 2), Math adoption and language practices, and best instructional practices in science, social studies, and elective classes.

Teachers enjoyed an afternoon of learning and planning for improved instruction. All of their hard work will be reflected in the academic achievement of our students.

Thanks
#isaacschools #excellentteachers

shared_text:
Sylvia Hernandez recommends Isaac School District No. 5.
January 24 at 8:53 PM ·

My experience with Isaac School District has been the most wonderful thing that's ever happened to me in my Lifetime working with the children, parents, teachers, field staff co-workers, administrators Including getting certified t by Department of Public Safety o be a Behind the Wheel instructor to train individuals to drive a school bus the leaning experience Ive done a Lil bit of everything like a jack of all trades...lol..😉✌️ 30 years of service here has been the best wonderful years of my life that I can say enjoying working at this school district the experience with the community of learning ....I'm Originally a School Bus Driver I joined the ISAAC SCHOOL FAMILY in DEC 10,1990- til Present..💗🤗 I Recommend that working here is a Good Job opportunity

February 12 at 11:11 PM ·

Hello, parents and community!

On Tuesday, February 12, we had a fantastic evening with the performance of the Isaac Middle School 6th Grade Band.

Please enjoy a couple of photos of these talented scholars and a short video of songs that delighted and entertained IMS families and community.

It is well documented that learning music supports the brain and cognitive development of scholars has a positive impact on other classes such as math and reading – comprehension. Because of it, all schools in the Isaac School District offer music programs.

Thanks
#isaacschools #isaacmiddleschool

post_text:
Heart of Isaac's 2nd Comunity Baby Shower was a success!

Next upcoming community baby shower: June 2020. Call to reserve your spot! 602-442-0583

Heart of Isaac Community Center

#HeartofIsaac #community #Babyshower #resources #baby #momtobe #prizes #free #family #parents
shared_text:
Heart of Isaac Community Center
February 3 at 9:39 PM ·

Heart of Isaac's 2nd Community Baby Shower was an eventful festivity celebrating new life with resources, games, food and activities.

Each mom walked away with a gift bag worth $70 and had opportunities to win additional prizes such as: strollers, pack n play, baby gyms, baby monitors and more.

We had a total of 19 mothers who participated and who also joined us in 2 additional parenting classes throughout the month of January.

Big thank you to the Heart of Isaac team, Warehouse, IMS, Perla, Susie, Lupita, Maria Z. Janeth, CPLC, WIC, Phoenix Children and all of our amazing volunteers!

Our next Community Baby Shower event will be taking place in June 2020. Call us at 602-442-0583 and find out how you can participate!

post_text:
Como usted muy bien sabe, esta temporada de gripe y enfermedades respiratorias está más activa de lo normal.

Actualmente, el riesgo para el público en el condado Maricopa es extremadamente bajo.

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added 21 new photos.
February 4 at 12:04 AM ·

Hello, parents and community!

At Isaac School District, our amazing teachers are always looking for ways to enhance instruction through real-world experiences and engaging lessons. An example of this is our very own Mr. Jason Catanese, a super math teacher at Pueblo Del Sol (PDS), who is using the concept of a restaurant to teach his 7th Grade Math class about percentage, tax, teamwork, table etiquette, customer service, and entrepreneurial discipline.

Scholars at this PDS class brought food, beverages, and some of them dressed for this special occasion. They took orders from PDS teachers and classmates. Most importantly, they learned in an original way.

Enjoy it, scholars! ¡Buen Provecho!

Please check the photos of this mathematic-delicious event!

Thanks
#isaacschooldistrict #learning

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added 12 new photos.
January 29 at 7:11 PM ·

On Monday 27 during our 7th period class, Mr. Catanese's 8th grade Algebra and Geometry students were honored with a Wetzel's Pretzel Party!

Mr. Steven Leibsohn, owner of the Wetzel's Pretzels Arizona stores, stopped by to honor our Pueblo Del Sol and Isaac Middle School mathematics scholars and congratulate them on their amazing success!

Pueblo Del Sol scholars and Isaac Middle School scholars were delighted with delicious and fresh pretzels.

Mr. Leibsohn shared with our scholars his personal experience in the business world and encouraged them to work hard to achieve their dreams.

For the past eight years, the Pueblo Del Sol Algebra and Geometry scholars have been honored locally, state-wide, and nationally for their achievements both inside and outside the classroom!

Thank you Mr. Leibsohn, Muchas Gracias, for this kind and delicious gesture to our scholars.

We are ISD Proud!

post_text:
We are excited to announce that the City of Phoenix is bringing its Pedestrian Safety Training Program to our 3rd-grade students at several schools within Isaac. The students will learn:

*What it means to be a pedestrian
*Roadway rules, laws and signs
*How to keep safe when you walk
*Walking Safety at Night
*Walking when you use buses or rail

Congratulations to fifth-grader Carlos Castillo Martinez of Mitchell for winning the 2020 Isaac School District Spelling Bee. Diana Perez Palacios, eighth-grader from Pueblo del Sol, earned second place, and fourth-grader Libni Alvarez Bautista, also from Mitchell, took third. All three students will advance to the Maricopa County Region III Spelling Bee on Feb. 21 in Laveen.

Thanksgiving Day Lunch at our schools can never be complete without a number of things including the support of our families and staff.

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added 30 new photos.
November 4, 2019 at 9:17 PM ·

Hello, parents and community!

We would like to share some pictures of the Día de los Muertos academic cultural celebration at Isaac Middle School.

At this event scholars, parents, and community members were delighted with delicious home-made food, refreshing aguas frescas, snacks, beautiful traditional face painting, and the traditional skulls made of sugar.

Also, during this celebration the participants enjoyed the stellar performance of “Chinelos”. “Chinelos are traditional costumed dancers, popular in the Mexican state of Morelos, parts of the State of Mexico and Mexico City”.

Academic-cultural events like the Día de los Muertos highlights the hard work of our scholars, parent volunteers, teachers, and community.

Enjoy! :-)

#Diadelosmuertos
#Dedicatedtostudentsuccess

shared_text:
Isaac School District No. 5 added 21 new photos — with SuperNova Wellness and Vamos AZ Run.
September 30, 2019 at 11:09 PM ·

Hello, parents and community!

We would like to share some photos of the Vamos AZ Run marathon where many Isaac School District (ISD) families and scholars participated. This event took place on Saturday, September 28, in Cesar Chavez Park.

This and several other family-sport events are part of the ISD and SuperNova Total Wellness Program working together in their commitment to a healthy lifestyle for Isaac families.

During this event, ISD parents and their children walked, jogged, and ran different distances. They had fun and danced during a Saturday dedicated to creating healthy habits. As always, physical fitness supports mental fitness, and Isaac students are racing toward academic success.

Please pay attention to the many photos where parents took their children and jogged with children in their strollers, and by doing this, modeled for their young children the importance of physical activity for a healthy lifestyle.

Thanks

@vamosazrun

Sneak Peak of today's adventures at Isaac School District. With the support of AZ Health Zone - Maricopa County Cooperative Extension program, Mitchel elementary celebrated Rainbow Day where they had the opportunity to taste a variety of delicious and nutritious fruits and vegetables prepared by ISD Food Services Department. Today is a reflection of how we provide nutrition and wellness education to our students to ensure that we help their understanding of food and promote healthy lifestyle behaviors.
